p: The worldwide outbreak of a new type of coronavirus (severe acute respiratory syndrome [SARS] coronavirus 2) causing coronavirus disease (COVID-19) has rapidly changed societies in the first 3 months of 2020. COVID-19 was first reported in December 2019 in Wuhan, the capital of Hubei Province, China [ 1]. As a response to a broader disease threat, China placed restrictions on travel in and out of Wuhan on January 23, 2020, but the virus was detected in Europe already in January in countries such as France (January 24, 2020) and Finland (January 26, 2020) [ 2]. Currently, it is not known how long there were active COVID-19 cases circling in Europe before different countries started to react to the epidemic. The first death caused by COVID-19 outside Asia occurred in France on February 15, 2020. In Italy, the number of infections started to rise rapidly in the last week of February [ 3]. During March 2020, almost all European countries placed at least some restrictions in an effort to prevent a further uncontrolled spread of the virus.
